abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the project, which
            was to check further deterioration of the states' road
            networks and improve their serviceability, was achieved.
            Project sustainability is rated likely overall. However,
            while it is likely in Tocantis and Piaui, it is uncertain in
            Maranhao. World Bank performance was satisfactory on the
            whole, albeit with some shortcomings in supervision.
            Borrower performance was satisfactory overall. Lessons
            learned were the following: Implementation of an optimized
            network rehabilitation and maintenance strategy can
            effectively bring an entire road network back into
            satisfactory condition over a period of a few years and at a
            reasonable cost. For networks or portions of networks with
            low traffic, surface conditions could be set lower. The
            results of the technical assistance components depend more
            on the technical experience and inter-personal skills of the
            specialists assigned to the specific tasks than on the
            experience records of the contracted consulting firms, which
            are at times deficient in controlling the quality of their
            services. Other concerns include creating a comprehensive
            atlas and geographic information system, providing proactive
            supervision and project restructuring as soon as critical
            assumptions have changed, increasing the Bank's share
            for civil works to improve the attractiveness of loans, and
            grouping two or more similar sub-projects under one umbrella
            although treating them as one project.
